content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the sloping ledge near the middle of the main face of the boulder. Move left on bad feet and crimps along the edge of the sloping ledge. Get foot on start hold, rock up onto ledge and reach for small pocket along crack. Find pocket up and left and top out. Large juggy flake above start to right is off.
content.location: Center right of the main face of the Red Eft boulder.

content.description: Start in the wiggling but semi-solid jug on the far right of the Red Eft boulder. Heel hook the rail and dead point to a large jug up and right. Mantle around the corner to the slab and top out.
content.location: Starts far right on the Red Eft boulder.

content.description: Undercling start left and right up to jug rail, get feet, bump up right to a jug then top out.
content.location: Left side of red eft boulder

content.description: On the left side of the boulder facing the trail just left of Red Eft. Stand start with your hands on the left side of the overhung prow, get high feet, get your hands over the top, and mantle over using the slab for feet.
content.location: The left side of the Red Eft boulder facing the trail.

content.description: Bear hug the overhanging prow.  Right hand up to a ledge to the right of the prow,  Keep left hand on left side of prow to top.
content.location: The overhang prow with the red stripe on it.  Shares holds with Path of the Mossy Skink.

content.description: Start on two bad crimps, get feet high, left hand in a small two-finger undercling in the middle of an upside-down curved rail, then get feet high again. Right hand to a pocket up and right and then top out on jugs.
content.location: The second route from the corner on the main face of the Red Eft boulder.

content.description: Large boulder to the right of the trail about two hundred yards after the stream crossing.  Moderate problems from V0-V3.  Slab walk off on back side
